title: disk space gets full - not clear behavior
body:
when disk space on server gets full, logs cannot be written and configuration cannot be saved, 
need to monitor that on codeine. 
exception should be better as well. 
Internak Server Error: 
java.lang.RuntimeException: wrapped exception - check cause for details, message from cause:Input/output error
        at codeine.utils.ExceptionUtils.asUnchecked(ExceptionUtils.java:22)
        at codeine.utils.TextFileUtils.setContents(TextFileUtils.java:92)
        at codeine.utils.TextFileUtils.setContents(TextFileUtils.java:71)
        at codeine.command_peer.AllNodesCommandExecuter.updateJson(AllNodesCommandExecuter.java:202)
        at codeine.command_peer.AllNodesCommandExecuter.createCommandDataFile(AllNodesCommandExecuter.java:136)
        at codeine.command_peer.AllNodesCommandExecuter.executeOnAllNodes(AllNodesCommandExecuter.java:62)
        at codeine.servlets.api_servlets.NodesCommandApiServlet.myPost(NodesCommandApiServlet.java:54)
        at codeine.servlet.AbstractServlet.doPost(AbstractServlet.java:51)
        at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:755)
        at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:848)
        at com.google.inject.servlet.ServletDefinition.doService(ServletDefinition.java:263)

        at com.google.inject.servlet.GuiceFilter.doFilter(GuiceFilter.java:113)
        at org.eclipse.jetty.servlet.ServletHandler$CachedChain.doFilter(ServletHandler.java:1307)
        at org.eclipse.jetty.servlet.ServletHandler.doHandle(ServletHandler.java:453)
        at org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.ScopedHandler.handle(ScopedHandler.java:137)
        at org.eclipse.jetty.security.SecurityHandler.handle(SecurityHandler.java:521)
        at org.eclipse.jetty.server.session.SessionHandler.doHandle(SessionHandler.java:231)
        at org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.ContextHandler.doHandle(ContextHandler.java:1072)
        at org.eclipse.jetty.servlet.ServletHandler.doScope(ServletHandler.java:382)
        at org.eclipse.jetty.server.session.SessionHandler.doScope(SessionHandler.java:193)
        at org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.ContextHandler.doScope(ContextHandler.java:1006)
        at org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.ScopedHandler.handle(ScopedHandler.java:135)
        at org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.ContextHandlerCollection.handle(ContextHandlerCollection.java:255)
        at org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.HandlerWrapper.handle(HandlerWrapper.java:116)
        at org.eclipse.jetty.server.Server.handle(Server.java:365)
        at org.eclipse.jetty.server.AbstractHttpConnection.handleRequest(AbstractHttpConnection.java:485)
        at org.eclipse.jetty.server.AbstractHttpConnection.content(AbstractHttpConnection.java:937)
        at org.eclipse.jetty.server.AbstractHttpConnection$RequestHandler.content(AbstractHttpConnection.java:998)
        at org.eclipse.jetty.http.HttpParser.parseNext(HttpParser.java:856)
        at org.eclipse.jetty.http.HttpParser.parseAvailable(HttpParser.java:240)
        at org.eclipse.jetty.server.AsyncHttpConnection.handle(AsyncHttpConnection.java:82)
        at org.eclipse.jetty.io.nio.SelectChannelEndPoint.handle(SelectChannelEndPoint.java:627)
        at org.eclipse.jetty.io.nio.SelectChannelEndPoint$1.run(SelectChannelEndPoint.java:51)
